See also: regen, régen, and Ręgen

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German regan (compare Yiddish רעגן‎ (regn)), from Proto-Germanic *regnaz. Compare German Low German Ręgen, Dutch regen, West Frisian rein, English rain, Danish regn.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈʁeːɡən/, [ˈʁeːɡən], [ˈʁeːɡŋ̩]
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Regen m (genitive Regens, no plural)

  1. rain

  • Eisregen
  • Nieselregen
  • Regenbildung
  • Regenbogen
  • Regenfall

  • Regenmantel
  • Regenpfeifer
  • Regenrinne
  • Regenschauer
  • Regenschirm
  • Regentropfen
  • Regenwahrscheinlichkeit
  • Regenwald
  • Regenwasser
  • Regenwetter
  • Regenwolke
  • Regenwurm
  • Regenzeit
  • saurer Regen
  • Schneeregen
  • Sprühregen
 

Related terms[edit]

  • regnen (verb)

Proper noun[edit]

Regen n (genitive Regens)

  1. A town in Bavaria, Germany.
  2. A river in Bavaria

Derived terms[edit]

  • Regener

Proper noun[edit]

Regen m or f (genitive Regens)

  1. A surname​.

German Low German[edit]

Noun[edit]

Regen m (no plural)

  1. Alternative form of Ręgen (rain)
